results.title: The Tin soldier. The Nightingale
results.creator_credit: Atkinson Film Arts, Crawleys Animation, Shanghai Animation Films, W. H. Stevens, Wang Bairong, Richard Morrison and Chris Schouten
results.brief_description: Two delightful animated children’s stories from the classic Hans Christian Anderson fairy tales, narrated by Christopher Plummer. “The Tin Soldier” is about friendship and love between a music box ballerina and a tin toy soldier. “The Nightingale” is an enchanting tale set in the mystical land of ancient China.

results.title: The Tin drum
results.creator_credit: New World Pictures, Franz Seitz and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: Winner of an Academy Award for best foreign film, this is the story of Oskar, a small boy, born into the feast and famine, the facism and slaughter of Germany during the rise of Hitler and the Third Reich. At three, he’d already had enough of this violent and confused world and decides he’d be better off to remain a three-year-old forever. Incredibly, he remains frozen in size and faces life with two weapons… his tin drum- which he bangs to drown out horror and lies… and his childish voice which he raises to a piercing shriek which breaks glass. German language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Black Sand Productions, Richard Schmiechen and Robert Epstein
results.brief_description: An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After 11 months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. (Awards: Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985)

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Black Sand Productions, Harvey Milk Film Project, Richard Schmiechen and Robert Epstein
results.brief_description:
An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After eleven months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985.

Credits: Producer, Richard Schmiechen ; director, Robert Epstein ; writer, Judith Coburn, Carter Wilson ; photography, Doug Dunderdale, Nancy Morita, Thomas O’Shea ; music, Mark Isham ; editor, Deborah Hoffmann, Robert Epstein.
Cast: Harvey Fierstein (narrator).

results.title: The Time to Live and the Time to Die = Tong Nien Wang Shi
results.creator_credit: Central Motion Pictures Corporation and Xiaoxian Hou
results.brief_description: The Time to Live and the Time to Die is the story of a boy in the early 1950’s, baffled by all the grown-up’s talk of “home” on the mainland, unmoved by the portentous news stories that come over the radio; the story of a teenage delinquent in the early 1960s, thrown out of school, getting into fights with rival gangs, feeling the first stirring’s of sexual curiosity. It is Hou’s own voice that speaks the narration at the beginnings and end, confirming the intimacy and the candour of these memories. But this is also the story of a generation, the generation that fled from the hardships of China in the late 1940s, settled in the comparative prosperity of Taiwan and then found itself unable to return. It’s a story never before told on film, and certainly never visualised in such piercing and accurate detail. This has nothing to do with nostalgia. It is founded on a warm but clear-eyed sensitivity to the ways that people talk, think and behave. The result is one of the greatest Chinese films ever made.

results.title: The Time of your life: the fundamentals of time management
results.brief_description: This film, which is based on Alan Lakein’s book “How to get control of your time and your life”, examines the everyday problems of time management. It looks in particular at the problems of disorganisation, interruptions, paperwork and procrastination, and offers workable solutions to these.

results.title: The Time of your life
results.brief_description: Record numbers of Australians are living longer. The increase in the numbers of elderly people poses problems with the provision of suitable community services including health and accommodation. At the same time society can discriminate against people as they age, depriving them of companionship, dignity and fulfilment. Indeed there is no reason why they should not pass the Century mark, leading full and active lives. Written and narrated by David Goldie.

results.title: The Time of your life
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, William Cagney and H C Potter
results.brief_description: This film is more than just a comedy - it was a labour of love for James Cagney and his brother, producer, William Cagney. Set in a waterfront saloon in San Francisco, the film has a warm and engaging atmosphere about it. It is entirely ‘laid back” - indeed Cagney remains seated for most of the picture. Joe (Cagney) is a philosophical souse who encourages all those around him to indulge in their wildest dreams. Joe’s pal Tom (Wayne Morris), a born patsy, runs errands for Joe, the only person who has ever shown him kindness. Kitty (Jeanne Cagney), a streetwalker, willingly allows Joe to sponge drinks off her in exchange for a few kind words. Harry (Paul Draper), an enthusiastic but hopelessly untalented dancer-comedian, is hired by bartender Nick (William Bendix) at Joe’s urging. And Kit Carson (James Barton), an addled old man who lives in a dream world, is prodded by Joe into weaving his unlikely reminisces of the Wild West. Based on the whimsical play by William Saroyan.

results.title: The Time of the monster
results.brief_description: An outline of social and political world events in 1933, emphasising the rise to power of Adolf Hitler and his National Socialist Party. Uses newsreel footage from the Associated British Pathe Library.

results.title: The Time of man
results.creator_credit: Metromedia Producers Corporation and Marshall Flaum
results.brief_description:
Man’s position in the long chain of evolution is portrayed with special emphasis on the problems of survival, pointing up man’s natural connection with all living organisms. Part of the series “The Natural history of the world” this film is presented in three sections:
I - Evolution and survival
II - Man and his humanity
III - Man’s modern history and survival
Narrated by Richard Basehart.
